title-part.text: TOYS, e.g. TOPS, DOLLS, HOOPS OR BUILDING BLOCKS

note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
A63H3/33 covered by A63H3/28
A63H17/267 covered by A63H17/262
A63H17/273 covered by A63H17/26
A63H17/385 covered by A63H17/36
A63H17/39 covered by A63H17/36
A63H17/41 covered by A63H17/40
A63H25/00 covered by A63H29/16, A63H31/00
A63H25/02 covered by A63H29/16, A63H31/00
A63H27/01 covered by A63H27/007
A63H27/127 covered by A63H27/12
A63H27/133 covered by A63H27/12
A63H27/16 covered by A63H27/001, A63H33/16
A63H27/18 covered by A63H27/00, A63H27/02
A63H27/20 covered by A63H27/00
A63H27/22 covered by A63H27/00, A63H29/18
A63H27/24 covered by A63H27/02, A63H29/00, A63H29/22
A63H27/26 covered by A63H27/06
A63H27/28 covered by A63H27/008
A63H27/30 covered by A63H27/02
A63H27/32 covered by A63H27/00
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

reference.text: diabolos or similar thrown and caught spinning tops or throwing and catching devices therefor A63B67/16; flying tops

note.note-paragraph:
Group A63H1/00 is impacted by reclassification into groups A63B67/16 and A63B67/165.
Groups A63H1/00, A63B67/16, and A63B67/165 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group A63H1/02 is impacted by reclassification into groups A63B67/16 and A63B67/165.
Groups A63H1/02, A63B67/16, and A63B67/165 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

reference.text: puppets or marionettes for shows or theatres A63J19/006

note.note-paragraph: In this group, the following term is used with the meaning indicated: "doll" includes a toy animal

CPC-specific-text.text: simulating physiological processes, e.g. heartbeat, breathing or fever

reference.text: with fluid ingestion or emission A63H3/24

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for a particular function not connected with dolls
Dolls capable of simulating pregnancy or birth

reference.text: connection of valves to inflatable elastic bodies B60C29/00

title-part.text: of flat paper to be cut-out, folded, or clothed
Flat toy figures provided with limbs, with or without arrangements for making them stand up
into which the fingers of the hand can be inserted, e.g. hand-puppets
made of parts that can be put together
with parts moved due to movements of other parts, e.g. limbs
Arrangements of sound-producing means in dolls
Means in dolls for producing sounds
Bellows, cylinders or the like for sound production

CPC-specific-text.text: allowing a choice of facial features, e.g. to change the facial expression

reference.text: change of expression through animation A63H3/48, self-moving A63H13/005; movable eyes A63H3/40
artificial eyes for human beings A61F2/14
wigs, eyelashes, eyebrows for humans A41G

title-part.text: Mounting of parts within dolls, e.g. automatic eyes
Frames, stands, or wheels for dolls or toy animals
Dolls' houses, furniture, or other equipment
Musical or noise- producing devices for additional toy effects other than acoustical

CPC-specific-text.text: sound-producing dolls A63H3/28; musical toy vehicles A63H17/268; acoustical vehicle-signalling devices A63H17/32; whistling toy locomotive arrangements A63H19/14

reference.text: ; music, sound or noise production in general G10

title-part.text: Pistols or machine guns operated without detonators
Toy figures led or propelled by the user
moving together with a toy vehicle

CPC-specific-text.text: or together with wheels rolling on the ground, i.e. driven by vehicle or wheel movement

title-part.text: with feet formed by rotary members
Special methods or compositions for the manufacture of dolls, toy animals, toy figures, or parts thereof
Mechanically or gravity driven toy figures
moved by vibrations produced by rotating eccentric weights
Figure toys with single- or multiple-axle undercarriages, by which the figures perform a realistic running motion when the toy is moving over the floor
Wheeled toys with figures performing a wriggling motion when moving
Mechanically-moved walking figures balanced by gyrostatic effects

CPC-specific-text.text: Toy animals with pairs of legs performing turtle-like motions

title-part.text: Figure toys which perform a realistic walking motion
with pairs of legs, e.g. horses

note.note-paragraph: New group A63H11/20 introduced in November 2005 is not complete. Documents from A63H11/18 are in the process of being reorganised to the new group

title-part.text: Toy figures with self-moving parts, with or without movement of the toy as a whole

CPC-specific-text.text: with self-moving head or facial features

reference.text: with a choice of features A63H3/365; movable eyes A63H3/40

title-part.text: imitating natural actions, e.g. catching a mouse by a cat, the kicking of an animal
Mechanical figures imitating the movement of players or workers
Toy models of fairs or the like, with moving figures
Figures staggering down an inclined path by means of the gravity effect
Toy figures swinging about a point above the centre of gravity
Tumbling toy figures operated by balls enclosed therein

reference.text: traffic games with figures moved by players A63F9/14

CPC-specific-text.text: made of parts to be assembled
Stunt-cars, e.g. lifting front wheels, roll-over or invertible cars
Launching devices for motorless toy vehicles

reference.text: start mechanisms for trackways A63H18/026; for toy aircraft A63H27/14

title-part.text: convertible into other forms under the action of impact or shock, e.g. arrangements for imitating accidents
shaped as armoured cars, tanks or the like
carrying a tank for transporting liquids
with cranes, winches or the like
in the form of a bicycle, with or without riders thereon
shaped as motorcycles with or without figures
Scooters with driver figure propelled by their wheels or by movement of the figure
shaped as sledges, sleighs, or bobsleighs with or without figures
Other wheeled vehicles with moving figures

reference.text: toy figures moving together with toy vehicles, led or propelled by the user, A63H7/04; self-movable toy figures driven by wheeled undercarriages A63H11/10

CPC-specific-text.text: Chassis; Wheel mountings; Wheels; Axles; Suspensions; Fitting body portions to chassis
Movable parts other than toy figures, driven by the wheels

title-part.text: Arrangements for imitating the noise of motors
Toy vehicles automatically steering or reversing by collision with an obstacle
Toy garages for receiving toy vehicles

reference.text: railway permanent way A63H19/30; for special railways A63H21/00

title-part.text: Propulsion by special interaction between vehicle and track

CPC-specific-text.text: Air-actuated track systems, e.g. with air cushion
Accessories for indicating the winner of a race, e.g. lap counters, speed indicators

title-part.text: Construction or arrangement of the trackway

CPC-specific-text.text: Actuation of track parts by the vehicle
Start-finish mechanisms; Stop arrangements; Traffic lights; Barriers, or the like

title-part.text: designed to cause movement of a vehicle by alteration of the inclination of part of the trackway
with mechanical means for guiding or steering
Electric current supply to toy vehicles through the track
Drives arranged in the track, e.g. endless conveying means, magnets, driving-discs
Control of vehicle drives by interaction between vehicle and track
Control of track elements by vehicles

CPC-specific-text.text: Means to improve adhesion of the vehicles on the track, e.g. using magnetic forces

reference.text: propulsion by special interaction between vehicle and track A63H18/00

title-part.text: Arrangements for imitating locomotive features, e.g. whistling, signalling, puffing
Model railway structures, e.g. kinds of arrangement of several units in containers, or on plates, or in combination with scenics for toy purposes

reference.text: models or scenery for general purposes G09B

CPC-specific-text.text: Devices for putting or removing vehicles on or from the rails, e.g. ramps

title-part.text: Mono-railways, e.g. with vehicles embracing the rail in the form of a saddle

CPC-specific-text.text: made of parts to be assembled

title-part.text: Other water toys, floating toys, or like buoyant toys

CPC-specific-text.text: Making or assembling thereof, e.g. by folding
Means for manipulating kites or other captive flying toys, e.g. kite-reels
Means for launching objects from aircraft, e.g. pilot, missiles
Collapsible wings, e.g. for catapult aeroplanes

reference.text: driving mechanisms with extensible rubber bands for toys in general A63H29/18
kite-sails or kite-wings specially adapted for water sports boards B63H8/10; kite-sails for wind propelled vessels B63H9/069

note.note-paragraph:
Groups A63H27/08 - A63H27/087 are is impacted by reclassification into groups B63H8/10 - B63H8/18, B63H8/23, B63H8/25, B63H8/50 - B63H8/70 and B63H9/068 - B63H9/072.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Means for launching objects along the kite string, e.g. with parachutes

reference.text: connection of valves to inflatable elastic bodies B60C29/00;

CPC-specific-text.text: combined with candy or other food items
Fabrication methods or special materials therefor
Inflation devices or methods for inflating balloons
Holding or sealing means, e.g. handling rods, clamps or plugs
Having means to guide movement, e.g. propeller or wings
with object inserted within; Means or methods for insertion of objects

title-part.text: Starting or launching devices for toy aircraft
Arrangements on toy aircraft for starting or launching

reference.text: for launching objects from an aircraft A63H27/004

title-part.text: Driving or controlling toys, e.g. toy vehicles
Drive mechanisms for toys in general
Driving mechanisms actuated by balls or weights
Driving mechanisms actuated by flowing media
Driving mechanisms with extensible rubber bands
Details or accessories for drive mechanisms, e.g. means for winding-up or starting toy engines
Remote-control arrangements specially adapted for toys, e.g. for toy vehicles

reference.text: steering mechanisms for toy vehicles A63H17/36; for model railways A63H19/24, A63H19/28

title-part.text: Gears for imparting a reciprocating motion
Gearing mechanisms actuated by movable wires enclosed in flexible tubes

CPC-specific-text.text: Devices for converting reciprocal or vibratory motion into rotary motion, e.g. for propellers
Convertible toys, e.g. robots convertible into rockets or vehicles convertible into planes
Infant exercisers, e.g. for attachment to a crib
Push or pull wheels, e.g. with movable parts other than toy figures driven by the wheels

reference.text: A63H33/02 takes precedence; for driving movable toy figures A63H7/04

CPC-specific-text.text: Playhouses, play-tents, big enough for playing inside
Toy swords or similar toy weapons; Toy shields
, i.e. rings to be rolled by separate sticks

title-part.text: Building blocks, strips, or similar building parts

CPC-specific-text.text: Mechanical, electrical, optical, pneumatic or hydraulic arrangements; Motors
comprising magnetic interaction means, e.g. holding together by magnetic attraction
to be assembled using hook and loop-type fastener or the like

title-part.text: to be assembled without the use of additional elements

CPC-specific-text.text: with rotation or translation, e.g. of keyhole or bayonet type

title-part.text: provided with complementary holes, grooves, or protuberances, e.g. dovetails

CPC-specific-text.text: with primary projections fitting by friction in complementary spaces between secondary projections, e.g. sidewalls

title-part.text: to be assembled by means of additional non-adhesive elements

CPC-specific-text.text: with wires, springs, suction cups, telescopic elements
with rotation, e.g. of bayonet type
using screws, bolts, nails, rivets, clamps

reference.text: A63H33/101, A63H33/102 and A63H33/107 take precedence

title-part.text: Perforated strips or the like assembled by rods, bolts, or the like
specially adapted to be assembled by adhesive or cement
